items.title: Runwal Enterprises secures Rs 5,000-cr cluster redevelopment in Marine Lines, Bandra
items.summary: Both projects will be taken up under the cluster redevelopment framework under Regulation 33(9) of the Development Control and Promotion Regulations (DCPR), which the state government has been actively promoting to accelerate large-scale urban renewal and infrastructure development.

items.title: Global renewable energy body plans to propose fossil fuel transition roadmap
items.summary: The International Renewable Energy Agency is gearing up to unveil a comprehensive strategy aimed at phasing out fossil fuels globally. This strategic plan will be shared with the COP31 leadership from Australia and Turkey.

items.title: Priority sector lending: RBI asks HDFC, ICICI banks to make extra provisions
items.summary: ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank have been instructed by a regulator to make significant one-time provisions. ICICI Bank must set aside an additional Rs 1,283 crore, while HDFC Bank is required to allocate Rs 500 crore. The regulator has also urged both banks to identify and address shortcomings in their loan portfolios. These adjustments are necessary to ensure compliance with Priority Sector Lending (PSL) norms.

items.title: Reliance sees gains from quick commerce and FMCG investments
items.summary: Reliance Industries' quick commerce and fast-moving consumer goods businesses are now generating profits. The company's efficient sourcing and focus on high-margin products like food and beverages are key drivers. Reliance's quick commerce operations are expanding rapidly, aiming to become India's second-largest player. The FMCG business has also achieved profitability. This growth is contributing positively to Reliance Retail's overall performance.

items.title: ET NOW to launch special show 'Davos Diaries'
items.summary: ET NOW is set to broadcast a week-long special show, 'Davos Diaries,' nightly at 9 pm, featuring exclusive interviews with global leaders and offering daily insights into discussions shaping the economic agenda and their impact on India.

items.title: India needs to narrow the insurance protection gap: Swiss Re
items.summary: India's total property exposure is now estimated at $26-29 trillion, according to a global reinsurer. A significant portion of this exposure is located in areas prone to natural disasters. These regions are characterized by a high concentration of economic assets that coincide with risks such as floods, cyclones, and earthquakes.

items.title: Power discoms clock ₹2,701 cr profit in FY25
items.summary: Indian power distribution companies have turned profitable in FY25, reporting a net profit of over ₹2,700 crore. This marks a significant recovery from previous years of substantial losses. Improved financial controls, better billing, and reduced technical losses contributed to this positive outcome. Outstanding dues to generating companies have also seen a dramatic reduction.

items.title: Railways speeds up shift towards engines run on battery, green fuel
items.summary: India is transitioning from diesel-powered locomotives, emphasizing the adoption of battery-operated and alternative fuel trains for shorter and medium-distance journeys. Following the substantial electrification of the railway network, the national transport authority is set to phase out the remaining diesel engines. Initial changes will be seen in yard operations, shunting, and last-mile freight tasks.

items.title: National Highway builders ask Finmin to clarify arbitration order
items.summary: The National Highway Builders Federation has urged the finance ministry to clarify its order ending arbitration for highway projects. The federation warns this change discourages investment and increases project costs. It suggests the new dispute resolution framework could make projects unbankable. This impacts ongoing projects and future infrastructure development. The federation is also flagging concerns with bankers and financial lenders.

items.title: Cutting risk cuts microfin's portfolio, recovery way off
items.summary: Microfinance loan portfolios have been declining since April 2024, according to industry leaders. This trend began after reaching a high of Rs 3.43 lakh crore. The decrease is attributed to loan repayments exceeding new loan disbursements across the sector.

items.title: Wall Street week ahead: Focus on Q4 earnings, income & spending data, Trump speech at WEF amid Greenland dispute
items.summary: Investors will be analyzing earnings statements from streaming leader Netflix, semiconductor giant Intel, healthcare major Johnson &amp; Johnson, and consumer goods firm Procter &amp; Gamble

items.title: Dividend Stocks: Angel One, ICICI Prudential, NLC India, among others to trade ex-dividend next week; Full list here
items.summary: Dividend Stocks: Firms like Angel One, ICICI Prudential, NLC India, Bank of Maharashtra, and Central Bank of India are among others which will trade ex-dividend in the upcoming week, starting Monday, 19 January 2026.&nbsp;

items.title: JioStar QoQ profit declines 33% in face of ad pressure
items.summary: JioStar's net profit fell 33% quarter-on-quarter to ₹888 crore, despite a 12% rise in revenue to ₹6,896 crore, driven by growth in sports and entertainment. The company noted healthy subscription revenue across digital and TV, with digital entertainment hitting record highs. However, the TV advertising market remains challenging.

items.title: Fundraise or not? Time to decode the growth dilemma for India’s start-ups
items.summary: The Indian start-up ecosystem is rapidly evolving, focusing on sustainable growth over capital raised. At the second edition of Mint's ‘The Unstoppables’, early stage founders learnt about the importance of strategic decision-making in funding and resource management.

items.title: UAE President Sheikh Mohammed bin Zayed to visit India on January 19
items.summary: President Mohammed bin Zayed Al Nahyan is visiting India for the third time since becoming the UAE President. Over the past ten years, this will be his fifth visit to the country. The frequent high-level visits highlight the strong and friendly relationship shared by India and the UAE.

items.title: In a 'turning point', discoms post  ₹2,701 cr profit in FY25, AT&C losses narrow: Govt
items.summary: Union power minister Manohar Lal attributed the turnaround to the Centre's initiatives, including the revamped distribution sector scheme and late payment surcharge rules

items.summary: USA-STOCKS/WEEKAHEAD (RE

items.summary: US President Donald Trump will deliver a speech at the World Economic Forum on Wednesday at 7 pm IST, adding to the high-level buzz around this year’s gathering. Ahead of this, the Ukrainian President is scheduled to address the WEF on Tuesday, setting the tone for key geopolitical discussions at the global meet.

items.title: India's bond market: How RBI ensured resilience in fixed income returns
items.summary: LGT Wealth India's CIO of fixed income, Chirag Doshi, shed light on how the Reserve Bank of India ensured resilience in fixed income returns as market sentiment swings between optimism and caution. Here's what the expert says.&nbsp;

items.title: Trident Realty to invest Rs 1,200 crore in developing a township in Panipat
items.summary: Trident Realty is investing Rs 1200 crore to develop a 125-acre township, Trident Parktown, in Panipat, Haryana. The project, backed by a Rs 250 crore commitment from IndusInd Bank, will offer a mix of residential plots, independent floors, group housing, and retail spaces. The township emphasizes sustainability and a wellness-oriented lifestyle with numerous themed parks and active zones.

items.title: Shipbuilding yard to come up at Kerala's Ponnani port under PPP model
items.summary: A major shipbuilding yard is set to be established at Ponnani port in Malappuram, Kerala. This public-private partnership project will be the second largest in the state after Kochi. The facility will initially focus on building small vessels, with plans for larger ships in later phases. The project is expected to create around 1,000 jobs and significantly boost regional development.

items.title: Budget 2026: MAIT seeks import duty cuts on critical electronic components, tax sops
items.summary: MAIT has submitted pre-budget recommendations to the government. The IT industry body is asking for lower customs duties on key electronic components. They also want increased tax incentives. These measures aim to strengthen domestic manufacturing and global competitiveness. The proposals focus on critical sub-assemblies and audio components. MAIT also seeks to position India as a global repair hub.

items.title: CII's Biz Confidence Index climbs to five-quarter high in Q3 FY26
items.summary: Business confidence in India is soaring, reaching a five-quarter high.  Firms are optimistic about demand, profitability, and investment.  GST rate cuts and festive spending are boosting sales.  The industry expects the Reserve Bank of India to cut repo rates.  CII suggests continued reforms and infrastructure investment for sustained growth.

items.title: Climate funding: Why PSUs are stepping in where VCs fear to tread
items.summary: Shipyards, gas utilities, global asset managers are reshaping India’s climate-tech funding. While venture capital steers clear, these legacy institutions and overseas investors are backing long-gestation technologies—from marine coatings to EV infrastructure to carbon removal—with patient capital.

items.title: 68% returns in 6 months! Multibagger stock in focus after firm issues assurance for  ₹5 crore subsidiary loan
items.summary: Multibagger stock Shanti Educational will be in focus of the market investors after the company issued a ‘letter of comfort’ assurance to ICICI Bank for a repayment of a  ₹5 crore subsidiary loan. Here's what investors need to know.

items.title: India doubles high-speed rail network to 80% in 11 years: Govt
items.summary: Indian Railways has recorded significant progress in strengthening its track infrastructure and enhancing safety standards through sustained investment and focused execution over the last 11 years. These efforts have contributed to safer, faster and more reliable train operations across the country, the Ministry said.

items.title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Monday
items.summary: Indian equities closed higher as a strong earnings surprise from Infosys boosted risk appetite and lifted IT stocks, helping Sensex and Nifty hit intraday highs. However, profit booking capped gains by the close. Analysts flagged mixed global cues, sector-specific strength and cautious technical signals.

items.title: New Rules for Vande Bharat Sleeper, Amrit Bharat II: Late ticket cancellations could cost up to 100% fare

items.title: Commerce Ministry formulates specific guidelines for missions abroad to boost exports
items.summary: New guidelines are in place for Indian missions abroad. The government aims to boost exports by diversifying markets. These steps are crucial amid global economic uncertainties. Commercial representatives will manage trade barriers and conduct market research. The goal is to leverage free trade agreements and increase their utilization. India targets USD 2 trillion in exports by 2030.

items.title: India is not at an absolute rock bottom valuation, but much better than 2024: Tata Mutual Fund's Rahul Singh
items.summary: Tata Tata Mutual Fund's Equity head Rahul Singh warns that manufacturing and capital goods still harbour pockets of unjustified optimism, suggesting investors are likely to rotate back into core categories such as multi-asset and flexi-cap funds.

items.title: Sumadhura Group to invest Rs 6,000 cr on 6 new housing projects in Bengaluru
items.summary: Sumadhura Group plans a significant Rs 6,000 crore investment for six new housing projects in Bengaluru. These developments will offer over 4,000 apartments and plots across 90 acres. The company anticipates a revenue of Rs 10,000 crore from these ventures. This expansion highlights strong housing demand in the city.

items.title: Goa announces ₹2 crore incentive scheme for airlines to boost air connectivity and tourism
items.summary: Goa is boosting tourism with a new airline incentive scheme. Airlines adding new flights will receive financial aid. The state also reduced aviation fuel tax. This policy aims to increase tourist arrivals. A new cruise terminal will further drive passenger traffic. New international routes are already operational. Regional flights are expanding.

items.title: Manu Joseph: Why do Indian films rarely ever depict the reality of how Indians speak?
items.summary: Indian cinema rarely sounds like real life. Most films turn conversations into farce or poetry, missing how young Indians actually talk, argue and love. A small but brave film release on YouTube breaks that pattern and hints at a more honest future for Indian movies.

items.title: Blue state turning red? America’s Democrats could end up losing the governor’s race in California
items.summary: California looks like the safest of America’s Democratic Party strongholds, but the race to succeed Gavin Newsom—who’s keen on a White House bid—is exposing a startling vulnerability. With only lightweights in the contest, a Republican could win.

items.title: Lodha Developers net debt up Rs 800 cr in Q3 to Rs 6,170 cr due to land purchases
items.summary: Lodha Developers saw its net debt climb 15 percent to Rs 6,170 crore in the October-December quarter. This increase stems from aggressive land acquisitions across Mumbai Metropolitan Region, Delhi-NCR, and Bengaluru. The company secured five land parcels for future housing and commercial projects. Lodha Developers aims for Rs 21,000 crore in sales bookings this fiscal year.

items.title: Ashish Kacholia portfolio stock Fineotex Chemical to be in focus on Monday; here's why
items.summary: Ashish Kacholia's portfolio stock, Fineotex Chemical to be in focus of investors on Monday, 19 January 2026, after the company approved the allotment of equity shares upon conversion of share warrants. Here's what you need to know about the allotement and the share price movement.&nbsp;

items.title: Parle revenue grows 8.5 pc to Rs 15,568.49 cr in FY25; Britannia maintains lead in biscuit market
items.summary: Parle Products saw revenue rise in FY25, though profits fell. Britannia Industries remains India's top biscuit maker. Mondelez India's revenue also declined. The Indian biscuit market is growing, with shifts towards premium products and strong competition from regional players. Companies are adapting with localized strategies to capture market share.

items.title: Fast deliveries, slow thinking: Don’t blame the quick commerce model for failures of the state
items.summary: The instinct to rein in quick commerce masks an abdication of responsibility. Unsafe roads, weak rule enforcement and poor labour oversight are failures of governance, not delivery apps. Expecting them to fill these gaps may be politically easy, but dodges the work of fixing institutions.

items.title: Silver rate today: Is silver price getting ready for a big crash after a Hunt Brothers-like rally?
items.summary: Silver rate today: If the COMEX silver price closes below $82 per ounce without breaking the current peak, then one can assume that white metal rally has peaked out, say experts

items.title: Barry Eichengreen: Global imbalances are under G-7 discussion but a fixation with China’s surplus won’t fix them
items.summary: Global imbalances are back on the G-7 agenda, with China’s trade surplus once again in the dock. But this diagnosis is incomplete. The way out is to revise domestic policy choices: the US must contain its financial excesses and China’s its savings glut.

items.title: Centre likely to prioritise debt consolidation, capex push in Budget 2026: ICRA
items.summary: The upcoming Union Budget for 2026-27 is expected to prioritize medium-term debt consolidation while maintaining a strong push for capital expenditure. ICRA projects a fiscal deficit of 4.3% of GDP, with a significant increase in capital spending to Rs 13.1 trillion, aiming to front-load infrastructure development before future fiscal rigidities.

items.title: BCCL IPO boosts confidence as Coal India weighs more subsidiary listings: CMD
items.summary: The strong investor response to the initial public offering of Bharat Coking Coal Ltd has boosted confidence within CIL and provided positive momentum as the company evaluates the listing of its other subsidiaries, Chairman-cum-Managing Director B Sairam said.

items.title: Mcap of 3 of top 10 most valued firms jumps by Rs 75,855 cr; SBI, Infosys biggest winners
items.summary: The combined market valuation of three of the top-10 most valued firms jumped Rs 75,855.43 crore in a holiday-shortened last week, with State Bank of India and Infosys emerging as the biggest gainers, in an otherwise sluggish trend in equities.

items.title: Silver rate today: White metal rises over 200% in less than 9 months. Is the  ₹3 lakh mark next?
items.summary: Silver prices have surged 200% since April, with recent highs prompting analysts to revise forecasts. Structural supply deficits and increasing industrial demand, along with central banks' interest, support a bullish outlook.&nbsp;

items.title: India-US partnership is growing across trade, technology: US Ambassador to India, Sergio Gor
items.summary: US Ambassador to India, Sergio Gor, on Sunday concluded his 'successful' visit to Mumbai, highlighting the growing partnership between India and the United States across trade, technology, education, energy and resilient supply chains.

items.title: After years of losses, power distribution utilities post Rs 2,701 crore profit in FY25
items.summary: Reforms like the Electricity (Late Payment Surcharge) Rules have helped bring financial discipline across the power sector. Outstanding dues of DISCOMs to power-generating companies have fallen by 96 per cent. These dues dropped from Rs 1,39,947 crore in 2022 to just Rs 4,927 crore by January 2026.

items.summary: The trustees of SRTT are Noel Tata, Venu Srinivasan, Vijay Singh Jimmy N Tata, Jehangir HC Jehangir and Darius Khambata

items.title: Govt. is proud of Indian firms investing abroad, is encouraging it: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal
items.summary: Outward direct investment by Indian companies grew nearly 46% to $20.5 billion in the April-October 2025 period

items.title: Penny stock under  ₹10 to be in focus on Monday; here's why
items.summary: Penny stock under  ₹10: Sellwin Traders' share price is set to be in focus on Monday, after the company announced multiple developments, including an MoU with last-mile delivery service provider Myzek Logistics.

items.title: India to grow at a healthy 7% in 2026-27 despite global uncertainties: CareEdge
items.summary: CareEdge Ratings expects the Indian economy to grow by 7 per cent in 2026-27 despite global uncertainties, supported by low inflation, softer interest rates and a lower tax burden. The rating agency said services exports would continue to support the external position even as merchandise exports face pressure from tariff-related uncertainties.

items.summary: Fresh tariff threats by U.S. President Donald Trump linked to Greenland have unsettled global markets, reviving demand for safe-haven assets like gold and silver. While near-term volatility risks loom for equities, analysts see potential longer-term opportunities for India through accelerated trade negotiations and shifting global supply dynamics

items.title: Budget 2026: Tata Motors bats for incentives to keep entry-level electric cars in the race
items.summary: Budget 2026: Tata Motors is calling on the government for targeted incentives to make electric vehicles more accessible to consumers. They are also advocating for electric vehicles utilised by fleets to receive backing under the PM E-DRIVE initiative. This request arises as budget-friendly EVs encounter market challenges, while fleet EVs, which are heavily utilised, remain ineligible for support.

items.title: UCO Bank Q3 profit rises 16% YoY to Rs 739 crore
items.summary: UCO Bank's net profit surged 16% to Rs 739 crore in the third quarter, driven by a 11% rise in net interest income. The bank also saw its non-performing assets ratio decline to 2.4% and gross advances grow 17%, supported by strong retail, agriculture, and MSME loan expansion.

items.title: Market participants seek equity tax relief ahead of Budget
items.summary: Market participants have urged the government to ease capital market taxation, including a higher exemption limit on long-term capital gains, ahead of the Union Budget for 2026-27.

items.title: GAIL’s Srikakulam–Angul gas pipeline connects India’s energy heartland with eastern coast
items.summary: Through the 422 km-long pipeline, GAIL has created a high-capacity, bi-directional gas corridor through Andhra Pradesh and Odisha connecting key commercial towns and unlocking industrial potential

items.summary: The changes aim to omit the requirement of establishing the discount in terms of an agreement entered into before or at the time of such supply and specifically linking of the same with relevant invoices

items.title: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing at Lucknow airport after bomb threat; search underway
items.summary: Panic gripped an IndiGo flight travelling from Delhi to Bagdogra. A bomb threat note found in a toilet prompted an emergency landing in Lucknow. The aircraft, carrying 238 people, was immediately surrounded by security. Passengers were evacuated and scanned. A thorough search of the plane and airport is underway.

items.title: Indian industry confidence hits five-quarter high on demand, reform optimism: CII survey
items.summary: Business confidence rose for a third straight quarter in October–December, lifted by resilient domestic demand, reform expectations and capex optimism, even as global uncertainty weighs on growth.

items.summary: The strong response from Europe comes after US President Donald Trump renewed his push to acquire Greenland, a semi-autonomous territory of Denmark. Trump has argued that Greenland’s strategic location and rich mineral resources are critical for US national security, especially amid growing interest from China and Russia.

items.title: Brazil, Nigeria emerging as key export destinations for Indian pharmaceuticals
items.summary: Indian pharmaceutical exports are seeing strong growth. Brazil and Nigeria are now important markets for Indian medicines. This shows a wider reach for Indian pharma products. The US remains the biggest buyer. Other countries like France and Germany are also increasing their purchases. This diversification strengthens India's position as a global medicine supplier.

items.summary: Crypto players say the current tax policies regarding cryptocurrencies are driving retail investors to put their money in foreign exchanges and not Indian ones.

items.title: Discoms post Rs 2,701 cr profit in FY25 after years of losses
items.summary: Indian power distribution utilities have turned profitable, recording Rs 2,701 crore in FY25. This marks a significant shift from previous years' losses. Reforms have reduced technical and commercial losses and improved cost recovery. Outstanding dues to generating companies have also seen a substantial reduction. These positive outcomes reflect the government's commitment to sector reforms.

items.title: Musk Seeks Up to $134 Billion Damages From OpenAI, Microsoft
items.summary: Elon Musk wants OpenAI Inc. and Microsoft to pay him damages in the range of $79 billion to $134 billion over his claims that the generative AI company defrauded him by abandoning its nonprofit roots and partnering with the software giant.

items.title: Mileage testing with AC to be mandatory for cars from October 2026
items.summary: New rules are coming for car mileage tests. The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways wants vehicles tested with their air conditioning on and off. This will give drivers more realistic fuel efficiency figures. The new rule applies to cars made or imported from October 1, 2026. Manufacturers will have to show mileage for both AC on and off scenarios.

Edelweiss Life Insurance targets breakeven by FY27

This growth will be driven by a balanced approach across multiple distribution channels and diverse products. Significant capital support is also planned to fuel this scaling.

items.title: World Economic Forum: Indian businesses must be competitive on cost, scale and resilience, says BCG
items.summary: By 2030, India is gearing up to claim its position as the third-largest economy on the planet. This ambitious trajectory is anchored in a commitment to scaling up manufacturing and pouring resources into emerging industries like clean energy and electronics. As global trade dynamics shift under geopolitical influences, resilience becomes a critical factor for success.

items.summary: Analyst consensus highlights 10 Sensex stocks with projected upside of 18%–32% over the next 12 months, signalling potential market outperformance. items.title: Steel prices hiked for the second time in two weeks as import curbs take effect
items.summary: Domestic steelmakers raised prices twice in January after India imposed a safeguard duty, as construction demand revived, inventories stayed lean and mills sought to recover margins.

items.title: FPIs' selling spree continues; Rs 22,530 cr pulled out from equities in January
items.summary: Foreign portfolio investors withdrew over Rs 22,530 crore (USD 2.5 billion) from Indian equities so far this month amid rising US bond yields and a stronger dollar, continuing their selling streak from last year.

items.title: DU hikes institution-level fees again; university share rises 17% in six months
items.summary: Delhi University is raising student fees again. Starting from the 2026-27 academic year, charges for university facilities will go up. This is the second increase in just six months. The university's share of student fees has now reached ₹4,100. This trend is causing concern among college administrations about the overall cost for students.

items.summary: The Ministry also noted an improved performance across important indicators as AT&C losses, gap between average cost and revenue realised as well as reduction in outstanding dues.

items.summary: Buy or sell: Ganesh Dongre recommends three stocks to buy on Monday — Wockhardt, LT, and HDFC Bank.

items.summary: India’s automobile exports rose 24 per cent in 2025, supported by strong overseas demand for passenger vehicles, two-wheelers and commercial vehicles, according to data from the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM).

items.title: FPIs selling in Indian stock market continues;  ₹22,500 crore withdrawn in January so far
items.summary: FPIs extended their selling streak into January 2026, withdrawing  ₹22,529 crore amid ongoing trade deal uncertainties with the US. Domestic institutional investors provided support by buying  ₹34,076 crore.&nbsp;

items.summary: Bharat Coking Coal Ltd’s IPO has garnered strong grey market interest ahead of its Monday listing, indicating a potential 54% listing gain. items.title: PM Modi flags off 2 Amrit Bharat Express trains from poll-bound Assam
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched two new Amrit Bharat Express trains from Assam. He also initiated the Kaziranga elevated corridor project. This significant infrastructure development will enhance connectivity to Upper Assam. The project includes a wildlife corridor to protect animals and reduce human-wildlife conflict. Bypasses will also be developed to ease town traffic.

items.title: Hyundai-Kia hit record 11.3% market share in US in 2025 despite Trump tariffs, driven by hybrids and local production
items.summary: Hyundai Motor and its sister firm Kia posted a record combined market share in the United States in 2025, buoyed by expanded local production and strong hybrid vehicle sales, despite Washington's aggressive tariff measures, officials said on Sunday.

items.title: Patna-Delhi Rajdhani halted near Chandauli over suspicious object alert; nothing found
items.summary: According to Circle Officer (CO) Arun Singh, the police received information about the alert at around 10:15 pm. Following the report, bomb disposal squads and dog squads were immediately deployed to inspect the train.

items.summary: Rising FII short positions in index futures and a near-record low long–short ratio point to heightened volatility in the January series. items.title: FII selling likely to persist until fresh market triggers emerge: Analysts
items.summary: The foreign institutional investor (FII) selling trend may continue in India until some positive triggers for a market rally happen, analysts have said. The sustained selling by FIIs continued for the week ending January 16. The total FII selling for January (up to 16th) stood at Rs 22,529 crore.

items.title: Adani Solar only Indian company in Wood Mackenzie's global top 10 ranking
items.summary: Adani Solar has become the only Indian company to feature in Wood Mackenzie’s Global Solar Module Manufacturer Ranking for the first half of 2025, highlighting India’s growing presence in clean energy manufacturing. items.title: Budget 2026: Luxury car makers seek duty reforms to spur premium car demand

Additionally, maintaining a stable rupee along with effective fiscal policies is essential for the growth of this luxury segment. Furthermore, robust road infrastructure is pivotal in stimulating demand for premium automobiles.

items.title: Rationalise customs duty on imported luxury cars: Mercedes-Benz India CEO
items.summary: This customs duty can be rationalised and brought under one slab...Only 5-8% of the cars we sell in India are facing customs duty and import duty. items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?
items.summary: Every Budget is presented in February and lays out the plan for the government’s spending in the financial year that will start in April that year. This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.
